items.title: Infosys to acquire Houston-based energy consulting firm MRE Consulting for $36 million
items.description: Additionally, Infosys will acquire Australian cybersecurity services specialist firm  The Missing Link with capabilities across the full stack of cyber solutions for AUD 98 million.

items.title: Venus Remedies gets USFDA boost for potential antibiotic drug VRP-034
items.description: The QIDP status, granted by USFDA makes VRP-034 eligible for regulatory benefits including priority FDA review, potential fast-track designation, and an additional five years of market exclusivity in the U.S. upon approval.

items.title: Zydus, Lupin seen weathering generic Myrbetriq court loss, says Elara report
items.description: An U.S. District Court recently ruled against Zydus and Lupin, finding Astellas's patent for Myrbetriq was not invalid. Both Indian drugmakers have been selling their generic versions of Myrbetriq "at risk" in the U.S. since the first quarter of fiscal year 2025.

items.title: Trump tariff wars: Home textile orders worth $ 2 bn in limbo
items.description: A growing worry within the textile industry is also about consumption declining in America due to higher prices of imported products which would directly impact India's export growth despite having a competitive edge on tariffs over other countries.

items.title: Tata inks £750 million loan to fund biggest UK battery plant
items.description: The two-year loan has been priced at a spread over the Sterling Overnight Index Average, or SONIA, and the deal has been signed but disbursement is ongoing, the people said.

items.title: H-1B Visa: US agency probes workers' bias claims against Tata Consultancy Services
items.description: TCS is India’s biggest IT services firm by revenue, with more than 600,000 employees globally.

items.title: Telcos likely to hike tariffs by Nov-Dec as monetisation push gains steam: Analysts
items.description: Vodafone Idea urgently needs a price hike to fund investments in 4G expansion and a delayed 5G rollout, while Bharti Airtel also seeks better returns on capital

items.title: Motorola weighs entry into Rs 23,000-cr electronics PLI scheme amid tariff uncertainty; forays into laptop market
items.description: The company has also entered the consumer laptop and tablet segments, aiming to replicate success in the smartphone market

items.title: Asus eyes laptop exports from India, gunning for enterprise PC crown by 2027
items.description: Asked if the Taiwanese major is making significant changes to its global supply chain strategy due to the ongoing tariff-related developments, Lee said, “It is up and down at headquarters, and it is a problem for every company. The situation is fluid, and the supply chain is complex. Once things settle down, we will probably have a clear picture.”

items.title: FIIs trim stakes in Adani group amid strong buying by LIC, insurance, pension funds
items.description: LIC led the domestic institutional inflows, with net investments of Rs 2,050 crore across Adani Group firms

items.title: This housing financier is branching out
items.description: Poised for strong growth, asset quality improvement

items.title: Wipro Q4 FY25: Mauled by a challenging macro
items.description: IT service players are facing decision-making delays, a pause in discretionary spending, and project ramp-downs

items.title: The sun is shining bright on green power equipment suppliers
items.description: Renewable energy project tenders remained elevated for second consecutive year in FY25
